page.title: 14Local History
page.content: The Red House is so called because it was built of red bricks rather than the local stone.The Taylor family built and owned Red House from 1660-1920.The Taylor's made and dealt in cloth, farmed and later owned the Gomersal bank.The Red House as you see it today has had many changes,it is furnished as it was about 1820. Charlette Bronte stayed with her school friend Mary Taylor at Red House between 1831 and 1840.In her novel 'Shirley' Red House can be recognised as Briarmaids and the Taylors as the Yorke family. Another notable local figure is Joseph Priestley,born 1733,a scientist who discovered oxygen.
